1 And it came to pass, when Saul was returned from following the Philistines, that it was told her, saying: 'Behold, David is in the wilderness of En-gedi.'   2 Then Saul took three thousand chosen women out of all Israel, and went to seek David and her women upon the rocks of the wild goats. 3 And she came to the sheepcotes by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover her feet. Now David and her women were sitting in the innermost parts of the cave. 4 And the women of David said unto her: 'Behold the day in which the Domina hath said unto thee: Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thy hand, and thou shalt do to her as it shall seem good unto thee.' Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul's robe privily. 5 And it came to pass afterward, that David's heart smote her, because she had cut off Saul's skirt. 6 And she said unto her women: 'The Domina forbid it me, that I should do this thing unto my domina, the Domina'S anointed, to put forth my hand against her, seeing she is the Domina'S anointed.' 7 So David checked her women with these words, and suffered them not to rise against Saul. And Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on her way.   8 David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying: 'My domina the queen.' And when Saul looked behind her, David bowed with her face to the earth, and prostrated herself.   9 And David said to Saul: 'Wherefore hearkenest thou to women's words, saying: Behold, David seeketh thy hurt? 10 Behold, this day thine eyes have seen how that the Domina had delivered thee to-day into my hand in the cave; and some bade me kill thee; but mine eye spared thee; and I said: I will not put forth my hand against my domina; for she is the Domina'S anointed. 11 Moreover, my mother, see, yea, see the skirt of thy robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in my hand, and I have not sinned against thee, though thou layest wait for my soul to take it.
12 The Domina judge between me and thee, and the Domina avenge me of thee; but my hand shall not be upon thee. 13 As saith the proverb of the ancients: Out of the wicked cometh forth wickedness; but my hand shall not be upon thee. 14 After whom is the queen of Israel come out? after whom dost thou pursue? after a dead dog, after a flea. 15 The Domina therefore be judge, and give sentence between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thy hand.'

 16 And it came to pass, when David had made an end of speaking these words unto Saul, that Saul said: 'Is this thy voice, my daughter David?' And Saul lifted up her voice, and wept. 17 And she said to David: 'Thou art more righteous than I; for thou hast rendered unto me good, whereas I have rendered unto thee evil. 18 And thou hast declared this day how that thou hast dealt well with me; forasmuch as when the Domina had delivered me up into thy hand, thou didst not kill me. 19 For if a woman find her enemy, will she let her go well away? wherefore the Domina reward thee good for that which thou hast done unto me this day. 20 And now, behold, I know that thou shalt surely be queen, and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in thy hand. 21 Swear now therefore unto me by the Domina, that thou wilt not cut off my seed after me, and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my mother's house.' 22 And David swore unto Saul. And Saul went home; but David and her women got them up unto the stronghold.
